title: Thunderbird won't download messages from one of my email addresses
creator: moreta56
content: My Thunderbird hasn't downloaded emails to my main/default address since mid January. The other two addresses, with all the same settings, and with the same provider, work. Emails are goint to my web mail. I've spent hours on support and on remote control with my provider, and they finally said maybe it's a thunderbird problem. I deleted the programme and reinstalled it, still won't download and all the emails are still missing from my inbox. The emails went missing when I attempted to repair the folders earlier in the saga.. All my local folders are there. I may have to start all over again from a new programme. Thank goodness I can access all emails from my provider's web portal. Aussiebroadband.

title: Trash and junk
creator: vanriet.jp
content:
Waarom zijn er in de samengevoegde accounts geen mappen "prullenbak en junk" voorzien. Dit zou heel makkelijk zijn, omdat je niet steeds naar de apparte accounts moet gaan om alles te verwijderen.

Bij Bluemail is dit wel en ik vond dat heel makkelijk.

Mvg J-P 

Why are there no "trash and junk" folders provided in the merged accounts.

This would be very easy because you don't have to go to the separate accounts all the time to delete everything.

At Bluemail this is and I found that very easy.

Grtz J-P

title: SMTP configuration for GMX
creator: rg.alix
content:
Hello,

I'm trying to setup a new GMX email address in Thunderbird. I can receive messages, but when I try sending an email, I get stuck on the loading bar "sending message". I receive no error message.

I have multiple GMX addresses in Thunderbird already, all work well for receiving and sending emails. I tried writing to email addresses with different providers, the result is always the same.

I tried adding the IMAP info manually and automatically in Thunderbird, nothing changes. Here is my current SMTP server :

mail.gmx.com Port 465 SSL/TLS Normal password

Can someone please help me figure out this SMTP setup ?

Thanks ! Alix

title: Mozilla's e-mail address for reporting code of conduct violations is not accepting e-mails
creator: antifascist
content:
Hello, can someone please fix this e-mail address please & thank you.

Following the instructions provided at this web page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Community/Community_Participation_Guidelines I e-mailed a code of conduct violation report to the provided email address, mdn-cpg-report@mozilla.com

Actual results:

I immediately received the following e-mail reply, telling me in effect that my e-mail could not be delivered:

Forwarded Message --------

Subject: Delivery Status Notification (Failure) Date: Sun, 15 Feb 2026 21:34:30 -0800 (PST) From: Mail Delivery Subsystem <mailer-daemon@googlemail.com> To: [redacted]

Hello [redacted],

We're writing to let you know that the group you tried to contact (mdn-cpg-report) may not exist, or you may not have permission to post messages to the group. A few more details on why you weren't able to post:

You might have spelled or formatted the group name incorrectly. The owner of the group may have removed this group. You may need to join the group before receiving permission to post. This group may not be open to posting. If you have questions related to this or any other Google Group, visit the Help Center at https://support.google.com/a/mozilla.com/bin/topic.py?topic=25838.

Thanks,

mozilla.com admins

Original message -----

[headers, etc redacted]

Expected results:

I expected instead to receive a reply telling me that my e-mail had been successfully received.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10

title: Why Professional Construction Project Management Is Essential for Project Success
creator: junipereva631
content:
Managing a construction project involves much more than just supervising labor on-site. From budgeting and scheduling to procurement and risk control, every stage requires careful planning and coordination. That’s why Professional Construction Project Management plays a crucial role in delivering projects on time and within budget.

With experienced project managers, contractors can streamline communication between architects, engineers, and subcontractors while minimizing costly delays and errors. Proper documentation, accurate cost tracking, and proactive risk management ensure smoother execution from start to finish.

In today’s competitive construction industry, investing in professional management services is not just an option it’s a smart strategy for achieving quality results and long-term success. Visit website: https://aaaestimating.com/our-services/construction-management-services/

title: Data Protection on a Shared Computer
creator: juergen
content:
Dear all,

I would like to use Thunderbird on a shared computer at my universitys lab space (it is mainly my PC but other people have access and use it sometimes). However, as we are requested to keep mails confidential I thought it would be as easy as just setting a primary password and thunderbird would not start if that password is not set. However, that proofed to be a wrong assumption. Instead if I just cancel the dialog it will open and still display all the locally stored mails.

We are using IMAP server and I already set up that the mails are not stored locally. Still, some mails that I have used recently are visible. I am aware that there would anyway be the local copy in the profile folder but I guess none of the people sharing that computer would take the efford to check that, so I would be fine if I could simply prevent thunderbird from starting without the primary password.

Is there any option for that or any extention that would do so?

Thank you in advance! Juergen
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:147.0.2;os:Windows 10;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/primary-password-replacing-master-password-thunderbird"];solver_id:7416581

title: almost all mails in sub folders of inbox have disappeared
creator: Frank207
content: I am really in a panic: Using ubuntu 22.04 and Thunderbird 140.7.1.esr For my main account I keep some 40 sub-folders and sub-sub-folders. All but the most recent mails in my sub folders are gone, something like 4 years of email. I asked chatGPT for help and found inside the /mail folder that most of the files with the names of my sub folders with no extension have 0 kb. I don't use IMAPS because I wanted my mails on my computer so I use only POP. :-( The interesting thing is that this only happend to my main account. I have 6 more accounts in Thunderbird and they seem to be fine, at least for now. Thank you for any help. Kind regards Frank

title: Support for PGP/inline
creator: zwergziege
content:
I would kindly ask for adding support for PGP/inline for Thunderbird on desktop. I am aware that there is a valid argument against PGP/inline and a workaround for using it regardless [1]. However, there are also some use cases, which apparently led to it being implemented for Android [2]. My use case are PGP/inline signatures for (unencrypted) newsgroup posts. In this context, the advantages of MIME are less pronounced and some disadvantages show. PGP is less supported by newsreaders, which in the worst case leads to illegible messages in the case of MIME. In some groups, multipart messages are prohibited by the charter. Similarly, for discussion based groups, attachments are seldom (or prohibited) and messages often monolithic, thus ensuring integrity even with PGP/inline. Also, privacy (unencrypted metadata) is not really a concern on a public message board. While PGP/MIME is a good default, newsgroups are an example where it would be desirable to have an option to switch to PGP/inline on a message-by-message basis or even as an account default. There are already PGP specific options in both, the account settings and the message settings. Extending that by another checkbox seems like a good solution to me.

[1] https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1446050 [2] https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/1974
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Linux;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/openpgp-thunderbird-howto-and-faq"]

title: Hotmail inbox connectivity problem: unknown error

content: The main problem is that, for the past three days, the Hotmail inbox has had some kind of problem despite the correct authentication. The connectivity is also correct, as shown by the message "A secure connection has been successfully established with outlook.office365.com:993." I tried cleaning the cache, but the problem continued. All the other accounts are working fine, as expected, including another Hotmail account. I've fixed the problem on another computer by cleaning the cache, and it's running OK now.

title: Month view in Calendar, can I navigate to different days using keyboard?
creator: timdier
content:
Hi all,

I am new to a Mac (1 year now) and am trying to make Thunderbird work for me as I have not been happy with other mail clients. I am struggling through a few things.

I like to navigate by keyboard if possible. In the Calendar tab using a month or multi week view, the "[" and "]" move month by month or week by week in multi-week view. How do I move to the next day or two using the keyboard?

A big thank you to all who reply, and sorry if this question has been answered many times before (I did not find the answer in the keyboard FAQ). --Tim

title: Critical UI regression and usability issues in recent rollout
creator: dilan.adler
content:
Dear Thunderbird Developers,

I am writing to express my frustration regarding the recent UI changes. After the latest update, the standard toolbar icons (Get Messages, Write, Address Book, reply, etc.) completely disappeared for me, leaving behind nothing but a search bar. Even using the "Restore Default Set" option fails to bring the essential navigation buttons back. While I can eventually fix these issues as a power user, these constant, breaking UI changes are a major problem for average users. For instance, my 65-year-old mother relies on a stable interface. Every time a rollout breaks the visual layout or hides basic functions, she is unable to use her email until I step in to fix what the update messed up.

Forcing users to manually rebuild their primary navigation toolbar after an update is not a "feature"—it’s a regression that alienates long-time especially elderly users who need reliability over constant redesigns. Please prioritize UI stability and ensure that "Reset to Default" actually restores a functional set of icons.

If you need further information I'll be glad to hear and hope you can give me an easy fix for this problem.

Please answer andere the following address: [edited email from community support forum] Or send a notification with a link to this thread

Best regards,

Dilan Adler
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36

title: Junk Section is missing from Settings\Privacy & Security page
creator: timdier
content:
My Outlook account moves what it thinks are spam/marketing messages into a "Junk" folder. Sometimes there are important messages here that I must mark as "Not Junk" so that I can continue to receive new messages from this sender in my InBox. I cannot map this Junk folder into Thunderbird even after I go through the steps and checkbox this folder to be synchronized. It does not appear in the left-side "All Folders" section.

Many solutions suggest that I make changes in "Settings\Privacy & Security\Junk" section. This does not exist. There, however, is a "Spam" section. Is this the same functionality?

Further, under "Accounts\Spam Settings\" there is a "Destination and Retention" section. There is no "Junk" folder available under "Other".

Does anyone else have problems linking server-side Junk folders into Thunderbird?

Thank you in advance for taking the time if you replied, Tim

ps. I've googled this extensively, and all the presented "solutions" are not accurate as the Thunderbird "junk" options they refer no longer exist. Has there been recent UX changes, and this is now a lingering bug?

title: Extensions in toolbars
creator: rogerandjennifer
content:
None of the topics suggested fit. I'm having trouble with getting extensions on toolbars. In the customize toolbars window there's a toolbar at the very top of the page that starts with mail, calendar, addressbook, etc. Just for example, the Google Calendar and Outlook Calendar extensions are in that toolbar, but I can't move them to another toolbar and that toolbar disappears when I close the Customize page (either way) and I haven't been able to find a way to get it displayed in other places. That toolbar is very similar to the toolbar that appears on the left side of the Thunderbird window, but that one doesn't include the extra extension buttons that I mentioned above.

Some people in various places have suggested that customizing Thunderbird toolbars is done the same way as in Firefox. But I haven't been able to find a puzzle piece icon anywhere.

By the way, I used to be able to add more toolbars, which I found to be an attractive concept, although that implementation didn't always work so well.
